Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: OliMonaco
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a hidden street close to GÃ¼lhane Park. 5 minuts walk to the Blue Mosque. Very nice decoration in the rooms and the bathroom - modern style. but rooms are very small. Nearly no space between the wall and the bed. I was alone in a double bed room and I found it small, so I cannot imagine sharing this room with a second person.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome at Minel”
Reviews.Author: AJourneywoman
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Minel hotel and came back when I passed through Istanbul again. The location is excellent - in Sultanahmet but on a quiet street. The rooms are small, as in most hotels I stayed in in Turkey and Greece, but they are clean and the beds are comfortable. The included breakfast is superb and the free tea and coffee all day is a nice bonus. Best of all, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super location. Staff always present and helpfull!”
Reviews.Author: mmffs h
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days in Minel hotel with our 3 boys (17 to 22 y). We appreciated the friendly atmosphere: people were always disponible to give information , offer a cup of tea or share experience in other travel...Good buffet breakfast with warm cooking. Room nicely decorated but rather small. Very quiet. Location is "just close from everything".We walked almost all time and use very few public transport.We really recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice location”
Reviews.Author: JuliS842
Reviews.Content: Minel is a really nice hotel, with nice staff, great location and a great breakfast. Room was a bit small, but nicely decorated and clean. I certainly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: Omar H
Reviews.Content: Hidden gen in Sultanhamet, located a short walk off the Gulhane tram stop behind the Montana Cafe and walking distance to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, and Blue Mosque. Rooms are standard European size and very clean. The service however is phenomenal, you are made to feel part of the family with offers of tea and coffee at all times and a great breakfast. Would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay at Minel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay (5 nights - Feb-2012) at Minel Hotel. You can trust all the positive reviews here, superb location, breakfast and staff, confortable and clean rooms. Mehmet and all staff makes you feel at home, always available to give you directions and good advice about the city. Dont bother your first impressions about the "alley" where the hotel is located, it is a very safe area and we always walked to all main attractions and restaurants near by even at night.

Reviews.Title: “A good find..”
Reviews.Author: Paspatout
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days trip in March after doing some research on Trip Advisor. First minor obstacle was finding the hotel as it's not visible from the street view and so had to resort to asking for assitance. The first person I asked was jettisonned abruptly when he tried to convince me I was in completely the wrong place, but he could take me there. I've travelled too many places to fall for scams like that. So I asked a local shopkeeper who pointed out that It was only 50 yards from where I was standing, down an alley between two cafes. Once in, I was happy with the room, which was clean and bright. As per other posters comments, the rooms and bathroom are very compact, which wasn't a problem for me as lone traveller with a small backpack, but may be a problem for a couple with luggage. I found the staff friendly and accomodating and I have to say that the breakfast was very good; a good selection of olives, salad, cheeses, and cold meats, supplemented by omelettes and freshly cooked crepes with cheese filling. After a good breakfast I didn't need a lunch. The only slight criticism I had was that because all the rooms were immediately off the rather echo-ing spiral staircase I was frequently woken late at night by the noise of slamming doors and the slap slap slap of feet up the marble staircase. Counter that however with the excellent location, opposite the Topkapi Palace and 5 mins walk to the Hagia Sopihia and Blue Mosque, and overall I'd say I was happy with my choice and would rate it as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “cute little hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: Yashodhara P
Reviews.Content: very centrally located,walking distance from all monuments.Small but clean and comfortable rooms.Young,vivacious and very helpful staff.Great breakfast and all the staff was very hospitable.Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect" , I could not find another word about MinelHotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ä°lhan S
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and well-groomed, friendly employees, very nice breakfast. I felt like house. In the middle of the historical areas. I'd recommend to anyone. Also, I thank all the hotel staff for doing their jobs willingly and well. MinelHotel is realy perfect. ilhan saklavci

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dorota_Ja
Reviews.Content: The Minel Hotel is a modern and comfortable hotel in the middle of the historic part of the city, within walking distance of Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque or Grand Bazaar. The room and the bathroom are quite small but clean and nicely decorated. Breakfasts are very big and tasty. The staff is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yasser A
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is perfect; few minutes away from all sight-seeings. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is awsame; especially "Gozlama :)". Staff is always there for us, they are helping us to plan our day, they would advise about locations that we did not know. Always welcoming to help with big smiles. It was a honeymooners trip and we really enjoyed our stay there. Rooms are very clean. Feels cozy. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for 5 nights in Istanbul in February”
Reviews.Author: Martina B
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at Minel hotel in February 2012 and were surprised by its simplicity, and warmth of the young people who run it. The rooms are small, but nicely arranged and clean. We stayed there in winter time and the rooms were warm (we had to open the window a few times because it was too warm). The bathroom was newly renovated, hot water in the shower, hair-drier, soaps and showergels, huge and soft towels. The best part of our stay there was the breakfast though. Scrambled eggs, cheese gozleme (that's turkish pastry), hot dog, different kinds of cheeses, fresh fruit... And all the time there they were serving guests with tea and instant coffee for free at any time of the day or night. And the hotel is 5 min from Topkapi palace, 10 min from Haigha Sofia and the Blue Mosque, 20 min from the Galata bridge...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jens C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, thanks to very friendly staff, nice and modern rooms and an amazing breakfast. The atmosphere was very homely and despite the cold wather it was warm in the room. Every time we came back we were greeted warmly and offered a "coffe or tea", which was very nice. There is no doubt where we will stay the next time we travel to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: prolet_adrian
Reviews.Content: The staff were extrenmely helpful and friendly. The breakfast was amazing!!! The location of the hotel is in the heart of the city close to all important sites. We highly recommend the hotel and would defineltely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend- great hotel, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Meighan M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Clean, comfortable, great location, friendly staff... all this for an incredible rate! It was the perfect hotel. I went on this trip with a couple friends. The staff were all so helpful and accomodating, allowing us to store our luggage when we got there early in the morning on the day we arrived and after we checked out (since our flights left late that night). We were only there for a short trip and we knew practically no Turkish, but thankfully the staff spoke English very well. They had all kinds of suggestions on places to go and answered all the questions we had for them. We were offered tea or coffee almost everytime we walked through the door. Breakfast was so good, omelets, several different kinds of breads, yogurt, meat, cheese, fresh fruit, etc. When you walk into the hotel, the front desk is right there and there is a nice size common room with chairs and tables. This is where breakfast is served and it is the perfect place to gather, have a cup of tea, meet other guests, chat with the staff, read your guidebook, plan your day, etc. The rooms were clean and modern, with a bright blue motif. I especially loved the large showers with both a handheld shower head and a large waterfall shower head (and plenty of hot water). The beds were large and comfortable with plenty of pillows and a nice warm comfortor. The only negative things I can say about this hotel is that there is no elevator (although the staff were very willing to help carry bags up the narrow stairs) and the double room/bathroom were a little small (but the space is maximized as much as possible). As for the location, it was a little hard to find because it's behind the main road that the tram runs along. I just asked a few people and they pointed me in the right direction. It's less than a block from the Gulhane metro stop and very easy to get to from there. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome. 15 minutes to the Roman Cistern. 20 minutes to walk to the Grand Bazaar and the ferries to get to the Asian side. It's around the corner from one of the historic Hamams, Cagaloglu Hamami (great experience, although pricey compared to others). It's an easy metro ride to take either the tunnel to Istiklal Caddesi or the funicular to Taksim Square (shopping, restaurants, people watching). And a cab ride to the same area is only about 10TL.The Gulhane metro is also a direct line to the Istanbul Modern museum and the Dolmabahce Palace. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “homely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MARTARD
Reviews.Content: Staff of hotel are awesome! They are very kind and friendly, and if you need something, if they can, they will help you!! Bebroom are small but very confortable and wellcoming! You can enjoy a good and delicious breakfast made by them!! Its situation is great because itÂ´s close of main monuments, restaurants and tram stop! ItÂ´s a succesfull option!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - first time in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: prof2012llb
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Turkey and this hotel was a great place to base out of. Close to lots of activities and historical sites. Very clean, very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back”
Reviews.Author: Slee1976
Reviews.Content: It was lovely to be back in the Minel Hotel, sadly only for a few days. This was some of the most kind and generous hospitality we have ever experienced in our travels. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfort, central location, amazing staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FirenzeOsmanDevrim
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel is now our number one hotel to stay in Istanbul. We have been to Istanbul a number of times now and Minel Hotel is the best value for your money. The location could not be more central being just a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The staff were incredibly accommodating and were available 24 hours a day, with a smile, for all of our needs. The rooms were cosy and modern and clean. We could not have asked for more. Minel Hotel made this stay the best one so far and we will definately be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Donglin J
Reviews.Content: It has perfect location that close to Blue Mosques, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and The Grand Bazaar. Furthermore, the best past was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Family style service! Fabulous Staff! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: alwyn r
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing stay at this little boutique hotel. The location is practically perfect within shouting distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and The Grand Bazaar. The best part was the staff! They were warm and friendly and helpful, especially Gonul, Mahmet and Massoud. No question was too much, no request too much trouble. If you are looking for great service at a budget, with a staff who puts you first, this is your place!!! Just be aware that there is no elevator service, so be prepared to take the stairs, but it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location new hotel nice design”
Reviews.Author: Mironaa
Reviews.Content: Hoyek is in the middle of everything very close to main attractions. The service is amazing, the people are really nice offering us tea or coffee at every time of the day or night. The rooms are exactly as shown in the pictures, quite small but this is typicall for istanbul. Heating is working (very important in winter time) and everything is new in the room and bathroom. One Negative thing, the beds are quite small for european standards the king size double bed is about 150, so maybe it is better to go for 2 single beds Breakfast is great, the small pasteries are delicious we really enjoyed our stay and would definiteley recoomend it I also loved the boutique design style, everything with a little turqois

Reviews.Title: “An excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Bibigenser
Reviews.Content: The best of this little an petty hotel is the way you are trated by he staff. They are always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: SammyJenkis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia because it looked simple and clean. I was not disappointed! The hotel is at very convenient location in sultanahmet near the tram rail and right next to the Gulhane park/Topkapi palace (a must see)! Minutes from the blue mosque or the Aya Sophia and several places to eat around there! Hotel itself is run by very friendly and helpful staff (e.g. I had to Turkey to US power adapter and they happened to have one they let me borrow). They went out of their way to give me helpful information to navigate Istanbul since it was my first time there. The room itself was kind of small (not sure if this is the norm in the area) but it was clean and had everything I needed. Breakfast was memorable - they had some items served buffet style and they would cook some other items right there and bring it to your table!! Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the center of the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Becca K
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Minel Hotel was fantastic. This was our first time in Turkey and staying there was the best. Not only is it within a two minute walk of all the sights in Sultanahmet (Topkapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque) it is very close to the Metro. The staff were all very helpful both before our trip while we were making arrangements and during our trip, helping us to navigate. As for the hotel itself, it was very bright and clean. The room, while small, was more than comfortable and very clean. The fixtures in the bathroom were new and modern, and again very clean. The prices were reasonable and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It made our stay in Istanbul wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Sophia1228
Reviews.Content: The design of hotel is cool! It is convenient to the sightseeing points. Most importantly is the staff there. They are so nice and I'm happy to make friend with them. This kind of warm feeling cannot be found in those so called "5 stars" hotel. I strongly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay at Minel”
Reviews.Author: Sangita76
Reviews.Content: Pros - Excellent location for tourists ( blue mosque and aya sofia are 5 mins walk, tram station is 2 mins, lots of eating options nearby) but relatively quiet neighborhood. You'll not have any problems sleeping. - Reception staff were helpful and warm - Rooms were clean and well maintained - Breakfast was decent, nothing exquisite but enough for you to start your day on a positive note - Airport pick up/ drop can be arranged through hotel for a charge (drops are cheaper than pick ups) - Nice collection of travel books. Cons - Rooms are very small but manageable if you don't intend to spend too much time in the hotel - No lifts and staircase is narrow Will recommend it highly for people staying for short duration (3-5 days max) for sight seeing purposes.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VladAlexandru
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel in Sultanahmet area is in a great location. Almost perfect location I would say because even if it's in the middle of the touristic area the rooms are quite silent during the night (only the slight sound of a tram can disturb you - but I wasn't bothered). The rooms are very small but the bed is big enough for two persons. The linen are not brightly clean (some stains here and there) but smell as "just washed". We had problems with the light bulb in our bathroom (big enough for a 5 days stay in Istanbul): it didn't worked and for 2 days they couldn't fix it. In the end everything was balanced by the rich great breakfast and the nice staff. A little bit to expensive for what it has to offer but still a good hotel for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, lovely service”
Reviews.Author: Ruth757
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Minel Hotel and we loved it. From the first moment we felt warmly welcomed and at any time the service was great. Although the hotel was centrally located and just a few minutes away from all the main attractions, it was really quiet. Rooms were very clean and the breakfast was delicious. The only thing that might be a problem for some guests are the really small rooms - nicely decorated, newly furnished but on the small side. All in all we would definitely recommend Minel Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Minel hotel Best budget hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Innovationzz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotel in istanbul for 3 nights in december 2011, the staff is so friendly and wonderful , the location of the hotel is very close to tram and city centre , old bazzar , eminonou . The room is clean and well equipped , the breakfast is wonderful and varied. I will absolutely recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “perfect place”
Reviews.Author: MARW V
Reviews.Content: great location, clean rooms, nice environment, the stuff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Candice C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location very close to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. I also liked that it is not on a main street so therefore pretty quiet. Our room was a good size, enough room for us and our luggage. It was also very clean. The best part was the staff - very welcoming, attentive, and overall nice people. Even though they did not have space for the last night of our stay, Muhammet booked a great place nearby on our behalf. If I have the chance to return to Istanbul, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfy, hospitable”
Reviews.Author: missennui
Reviews.Content: Mehmed and Gonul were wonderful hosts, welcoming me into their hotel with hot tea and freshly cooked chicken. The location is prime, the rooms are pristine and modern, and the breakfast is to die for. Highly recommended accommodation in Istanbul and well worth the price! Thank you for being such lovely and accommodating hosts :)

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect stay in the heart of sight seeing sights"”
Reviews.Author: Hazem S
Reviews.Content: Excellent service,hospitality ,great breakfast ,room is cute and neat,it is the perfect way to feel home,,the staff is great ,thanx to mohamet and rest of the people we had a lovely stay and people help alot with where to go :)" (4th of dec to the 11th of dec) Regards, Hazem Oh I LOVE THE CATS THERE,,, amazing :P,,,and people just offer you tea all the time in a very cute way,, and the hotel is few minutes walk from the main touristic spots,,, its perfect location really,, Thank you Minel

Reviews.Title: “Minel hotel - Like a family!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina_Jorge_Spain
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot through all the world, and I have to say that as well as I have been in Minel hotel, I haven't been in anywhere else. People working there are the nicest people ever, and you can feel there like if you were at home. Although bedrooms are not very big (and I think this is not the most important aspect) they are clean, tidy and beautiful. Everything's decorated with a great taste and so clean. I have to thank all the staff at Minel Hotel for such great days in Estambul. Thank you! And I hope to visit you again. For all the travellers visiting Estambul, wether families, couples or friends, I highly recommend this great hotel. Don't doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Minel Hotel - The best choice!”
Reviews.Author: _Sonia_Catalunya_
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a trip to Istanbul, here's my suggestion: Chose Minel Hotel! It's a small and familiar hotel, rooms are not too big but with an excelent equipment and cleanliness. The staff (all of them) are more than friendly, helpful, kind, professional... If I have to be honest, the staff is the best value of Minel Hotel! They'll make you feel like at home. Location is excellent; just a 5 minutes walk to Istanbul' main attractions and located in the heart of Sultanahmed. I felt in love with the city and I'll defenitely come back soon; and, Minel Hotel will be my accomodation again, for sure. Thank you all, guys, for all your professionality. Take care! SÃ²nia

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in big city”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: In a few words: this hotel has everything I desire in his price class; it has: - Very good location close to the blue mosquee and the palace yet a quiet place, - New and really clean, - easy to reach with street-car but not on the main street, - Also good breakfast, - and, very important, nice staff, they gave plenty of good advice. I would definitely return on my next visit in Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “New home with new family members”
Reviews.Author: arashdehghan
Reviews.Content: In this hotel you feel you are living at your home with new family members

Reviews.Title: “A place where you will feel home”
Reviews.Author: Annalisa_syriana
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and romantic place. Staff is very kind and you really have the feeling of being home. Rooms are a bit small but so comfortable and warm. Breakfast is so yoummy, i so miss it by the way :D Location is perfect, next to the blue mosque and many other wonderful places.. If I ever come back to Istanbul I will surely book there again :)

Reviews.Title: “the best relationship between price and quality in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PhilouTT
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location near tramway stop and blue mosque in old Istanbul. Staff is very helpful and nice with a lot of tipps: thank you again for this nice stay. Rooms are small but clean and complete, included hair dryer, towel radiator, top shower... Furthermore, the beds are very confortable and we spend a great night. The breakfast is fresh and very good but may be one improvement: from 8:30 is may be too late, better would be from 07:30. Pick-up from the airport very comfortable and pleasant. I strongly recommend it for a week end

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bindhi34
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay for a great price and right next to the Aya Sophia. The hotel was very clean, comfortable (great bed and pillows) and the staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. The staff would offer us tea or coffee every night when we came back to the hotel and were available 24/7 if we needed anything. Breakfast had wonderful fresh fruits and delicious coffee, which was appreciated. We could walk anywhere from the hotel and there were also some fantastic restaurants nearby. I highly recommend this hotel! Thanks Minel staff for your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JohnCheshire111
Reviews.Content: The Minel Hotel is an excellent choice for a short stay in Instanbul. Rooms and bathrooms are compact but adequate in every way and are totally modern and clean. The location of the hotel is excellent, situated in a small pedestrian-only street (good for a quiet night's sleep) the hotel is in walking distance of many of the main sights and is also very close to the tramway for travel further afield. A choice of bars and restaurants are nearby. Breakfasts are good with plenty of choice. The Reception Staff are all very pleasant and are pleased to help with advice and tips for your stay in Istanbul John Cheshire, Nantwich U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: xslava
Reviews.Content: Good location, staff was very helpful and friendly, good value, very clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mntnaz
Reviews.Content: Really good location to the sights and close to the tram station. The people working in the Minel were very helpful and seemed to go the extra mile for you. Good value. Rooms were way too small. I don't mind small rooms, but it was barely possible to walk around the bed. The bathroom was also too small. The hotel provided a decent mixture of food for breakfast, but it isn't served early enough if you need to get an early start in the morning. One other negative...they really wanted you to use Euros to pay for the room. They didn't want us to use the credit card, but we didn't have Euros since we planned to pay with the credit card. I really believe this hotel is perfect for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “take it now!”
Reviews.Author: khenaro
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1) The hotel is perfectly situated for everything: food, sightseeing, shopping in grand bazaar, going somewhere else by metro. 2) Good sleep quality, I don't know whether they were so quiet, but we haven't heard our neighbors, no sounds from the street as well. 3) Guys running the hotel are very nice: tea or coffee any time you want, if anything else is needed - they are ready to help, happy to chat with you, breakfast is also as at home. Minor notes: Though the hotel is nicely decorated, I am afraid it is ok only while it is new. Rooms are not very well cared: some piece is broken here, some lamp is not working there... Not the main things indeed: TV, a/c, bath, wi-fi are fine. At least for the closest year I believe that should be absolutely ok. And for full-size people as well as elder ones - rooms are very small indeed and the stairs are a bit tricky.

Reviews.Title: “100% Accomodation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janice L
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in this hotel in Istanbul and enjoyed the stay there. The staff are very very friendly and helpful. It has the perfect/ideal location to the main tourist sites and restaurants etc. All these advantages at a very good price too. I highly recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: renatagds78
Reviews.Content: Great team! Very friendly and caring! It was my boyfriend's birthday and they prepared a surprise for him, it was amazing. The room is well decorated and modern, as well as throughout the hotel. The Hotel is clean and very well located, very close to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace in front of. Breakfast plentiful and very tasty. The bed room is wonderful. They have a great and inexpensive shuttle service to the airport. It was a great stay! I super recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: StephEtMuriel
Reviews.Content: Very well located (close to the tram and the main touristic places), very friendly people and nice rooms... all this for a very good price. We really recommend this hotel and will certainly come back for our next trip to Istanbul (if we have the luck to come back!)

Reviews.Title: “better than 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad S
Reviews.Content: classy small hotel with perfect location from where you can get into everywhere the services and the higyen is btter that 5 stare with lovely atmospher as i stayed the first 02 nights in 5 star hotel and i like minel hotel more; frindly people runing the hotel who will help you and give you a good recommondations and information about your tours. and welcome you with a cup of tea, go ahead and book it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Samuel B
Reviews.Content: Our arrangements worked out perfect from the minute we arrived at the airport in Istanbul. Metin arranged our pick up at the airport, he drove us directly to the hotel where we were warmly greeted. The staff are all very friendly and offered some excellent suggestions for our brief stay in this wonderful city. The hotel location proved to be perfect as it was in the old town area where we visited the historic sites. Our room was fresh and clean. The bathroom was larger than I expected, especially the shower, which had plenty of hot water. I was also please to have bed service and clean towels daily...nice large towels! The breakfast we very nice and more than I expected as well. After traveling for several days prior in Italy, I enjoyed having eggs for breakfast and plenty of other selections as well. How nice it was each evening to be greeted by the staff and to be offered hot tea or coffee before retiring to our room. We were also able to arrange our return trip to the airport...and right on time our driver arrived. The Minel Hotel is an excellent choice for anyone who wants the convenience of a location to visit the wonderful city of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with top class service.”
Reviews.Author: LukasKopec
Reviews.Content: We had stayed 6 nights in this very friendly place. Hotel is situated in the heart of Sultanahmet district, just 5 minutes walk from Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and millions of shish kebabs and kofte restaurant. Although it's a very busy part of the very busy city, Minel is situated on the small narrow back-street. You can find the peaceful, quiet atmosphere and have delicious turkish breakfast under the fig tree. The rooms are not very spacious, but modern and clean. Equipped with all necessary amenities; a/c unit, central heating, fridge, big shower, hair dryer, cable TV, wireless network. There's a plenty of books, tourist guides and photo albums in different languages, you can read and borrow. We were absolutely amazed by great, friendly service from all the staff. They were very helpful and informative about local attractions, food (thanks Mehmet for showing us 'boza bar') music and culture. They will make all required travel arrangements if needed. We highly recommend this place and people who works there. You should not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel in the old town part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DerekFGuadalajara
Reviews.Content: Hard to find location,but only just off the main road and within walking distance of all the attractions in the old town. Very clean and quiet hotel,with a bed and breakfast type feeling. Staff are very friendly though do not know much English. We recommend this hotel for those wanting an inexpensive but friendly experince ata great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Great Personalized Service”
Reviews.Author: Blaine1953
Reviews.Content: We are just over the jet lag from our trip to Turkey. It is a fabulous country to visit. The people, services, food and transportation systems were beyond our expectations. Everyone should go to Istanbul once in their life time...what a city!! The Minel hotel is located very close to the all the attractions and right across the street from the city light rail service. Although the room we had was bit small, it was modern and very clean! We did not spend much time in the room as Istanbul has alot of things to see and stay busy with. We strongly recommend this hotel as it more a boutique hotel with the owner on site with personalized service, and a great breakfast which included with the price. This hotel was rated #1 on TripAdvisor when we were looking for a hotel in a good location and was just that - a great hotel! Blaine Wendy Calgary Canad

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fatfoot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Minel for about a week and it was great. Staff were amazing, they were so friendly and willing to help with any request. Rooms were really clean, bed was comfortable and I loved the gozleme for breakfast. The location was alos great, easy walk to all the main attractions in Sultanahmet. I would definitely recommend this place, if I get to go back to Istanbul I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about it is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Simions
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Minel for five days and it was absolutely pleasant. Firstly, the location is fantastic- it is so close to all of the things you want to see. The rooms are very affordable, as well as clean and tidy. But the thing that sells the place is the staff! They offered us suggestions on what to see and how to get there, they always ensured we had enough food for breakfast... I could go on but all you need to know is they are super friendly and super helpful. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: kazza88871
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel was in an absolutely perfect location for visting the main places places in Istanbul. The hotel is is tiny little side street off of the min tramway T1 (take this from ferry port). The Topkapi Palace walls were 50 steps from the hotel!.The Blue Mosque is approx 5 min walk and Grand Bazaar about 10 mins. Very clean hotel, rooms small, and compact but modern and tasteful. There is a fantastic shower and brilliant hairdryer in the bathroom (not one of those silly ones that don't stay on!!) so leave that at home. Owners are very friendly and helpful. Free tea, coffee and turkish 'Chi' are available at any time of the day or upon your return from an evening out. Just ask!. We were there for 5 days, and the breakfast was a small buffet style, same each day but ok. Fresh omelettes, speciality warm Turkish cheese pastry (delicious) and usual breads, cold meats, cheeses etc. Also natural yoghurt and james/honey.If I was going to be a tiny bit critical , only thing that ruined the breakfast was cheap tasting margarine. Butter would have been nice. Also, we were on the first floor, and as the stairwell is open from the dining area/reception, it was a bit noisy on occasions at night, but not much of a problem.Free cans of drink in mini bar in room. This hotel is in a perfect location, lovely little hotel and excellent value for money. Upon leaving, when settling the bill, I offered my credit card to pay, the owner was a bit disgruntled and tried to get me to pay cash for our stay (a little moan about charges etc) but I did pay by card as we didn't have enough cash. Just a little tip there!! I would recommend thi hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abdelilah C
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel have a very excellent location, near of all historical Istanbul sites, Sultanahmet, AyaSofia, basilic citern, hippodrome... and 1 minute to the tram station 'Gulham station'. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and everytime you can use the library of the hotel and drinking turkish tea/coffee... The rooms is clean, with a modern design and nice colors... The breakfast is very good and varied...

Reviews.Title: “superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: shytinky
Reviews.Content: very good value hotel with friendly & helpful staff, clean & modern room, and walking distance from tourist attraction and tram line.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, new and well located!”
Reviews.Author: jt10s
Reviews.Content: Loved: Hotel is very new (opened May this year) and as such, towels are still plush, comforters are still billowy. Good a/c and heater. Good water pressure for shower. Breakfast is good and filled you up for the morning. With only 9 rooms, it felt like you were staying at a posh friend's guestroom (which was great and I looked forward to coming back after a long day of traipsing around town). Some hotel staff have better English than others. That being said, I got very detailed directions to where I needed to go (even directions for using the bus). Staff were very hospitable, greeting you every time you came or went and offered tea / coffee every time they saw you. Staff were also honest that there are few decent (ie. non-tourist-trap) restaurants in the area. If you can, head over to the Istiklal Caddesi area (across the Galata Bridge) for meals. Much better selection at better prices. Loved being close to all the mosques, palaces and museums. Wonderful to see them in the day and then again lit up at night. Didn't like: Breakfast never changed, so after five days of exactly the same thing, it got a bit dull. Staircase to rooms is open, so if you have customers speaking loudly in Reception, you'll hear it from your room (at least I did, on the first floor). Otherwise, the hotel is quiet (it's on a side street off a side street). Be forewarned that the rooms are SMALL. Like just big enough for a double bed with a bit of room to spare. That being said, the design was very compact with lots of storage space. So once you get organized, it was good (except for the bathroom, which you needed a bit of acrobatics to negotiate...) However, I felt the hotel offered great value! Tips: (1) There is a shared shuttle going back to the airport for only 5 euro, bookable through the hotel. (2) Ask directions from the hotel how to get here FROM the airport. You can use combo metro/tram (but if you're arriving during working hours, the tram will be VERY crowded). It's a short 5-7 minute walk from the closest tram station. (3) Every time you switch lines, you will need to pay. You can either pay TL2 for a token or buy a transportation card which you top up with money (strangely, these are sold by regular kiosks selling other things, like kebabs). The benefit of the card (TL6, non-refundable) is that your subsequent trips (within 2 hours) are discounted (1st trip, TL 1.75, 2nd trip, TL 1.00). Didn't see them on sale at the airport and the ticket booth was unmanned with ticket machines only in Turkish (!) I totally fell in love with Istanbul and Minel Hotel was a good base for traveling. You could even walk to Eminonu in about 20 minutes (where the Bosphorus cruises leave from). For more tips on what to do in Istanbul check out my travel blog: http://dreamtravelblog.wordpress.com/2011/10/17/istanbul-a-love-letter/

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, clean & warm place !!”
Reviews.Author: Carly C
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet, nice, helpful and funny staff, room is modern & stylish with white & blue color mix....good design.... just a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: erik68_sweden
Reviews.Content: Great hotel staff. Always friendly and helpful. Nice and plentiful breakfast with the best figs I have ever eaten. The hotel is hidden away on a quiet side street, but within 10 minutes walk to the Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Bazaar. Nice and clean room with a good shower and air condition. We will be staying there next time when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Luton
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Staff were very hospitable. Great location for the Blue Mosque and the TopkapÄ± Palace. Good breakfast. The rooms were compact, clean and all the essentials that you would need for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on a toplocation!”
Reviews.Author: Neleke1
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on a toplocation near Topkapi, Aya Sophia and Blue Moskee. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Lovely rooms, a little bit small but it's oke for a cititrip. The price is unbelievable as it has also a nice breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Trip in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Veromca
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Minel Hotel for few days.It was very clean and neat.The most important thing was that the people were so nice and friendly.Breakfast was tasty and we could try the real Turkish meal in the morning.What my favorite was its well-designed room,it was really adorable.Moreover,the fascinating attractions are very close to Minl Hotel.I wish i could stay there again if i travel there again because the price is quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Trip in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: michele s
Reviews.Content: Nice little low budget hotel, very clean and confortable. The people which works there is educated and friendly. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “clean boutique hotel and very convinient location”
Reviews.Author: Beijingers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Minel hotel this month and very happy with our time here. Hotel room is very small but clean. And we love the central location as it is within minutes walking to train station and most sights.

Reviews.Title: “unreliable customer service”
Reviews.Author: travel53
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean & centrally located.but they lack in service.some of the info provided for local area hotels was incorrect.they forgot to wake us up foe flights.may be there is a language issue.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Traveller”
Reviews.Author: 472Traveller472
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel staff provide excellent customer services and tour information. The room was modern, clean, quiet, cosy, comfortable with a garden view and awesome daily continental breakfast. (Thanks and appreciation to you all). Location is central within easy minutes walk to most sight seeing places, the tram, hop-on-off-bus, restaurants and travel agencies, shops, supermarket, etc. Everyone, including the natives is warm, friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Daily Tours who were also knowlegeable, helpful and professional, including tour guide Dilek Celik and Marmara from Canter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: Jud1981
Reviews.Content: We were in the hotel 2 days and we loved it. The hotel is new, very nice and cosy. The hotel rooms are small, but the situation of the hotel -very centric but in a quiet street- and the breakfast buffet -very complet- makes it an absolutely recomendable hotel in Istambul. Also, the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed the stay and of course i recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: MatteoCalabresi
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay and of course i recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and fantastic services”
Reviews.Author: Jongjin
Reviews.Content: I stayed Minal hotel two night and it's great pleasure for my family I travel Turkey for 10 days and Minal hotel is the best one in Turkey It's position is very near the Gulhane tram station so easely reach anywhere Staffs are very kind and speaks fluent English and even one of them speaks Korean quiet well!!, One not good point is that there is no elevator but they move our luggage at the room when we are check in and out. If you are staying this hotel, I promise you will not regret

Reviews.Title: “very pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: jisun294197
Reviews.Content: the cost of the room was reasonable. the loctaion is perfect . close to from sophia, gukhane park, blue Mosque! i could walk easy most of place from hotel. Beutiful hotel and nice room decoration, comfortable bed. the reception was very friendly. they couldn't have been better. i had great experience with minel hotel. if i go istanul i will stay here again, i highly recommend Minel Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good price”
Reviews.Author: rakelet
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Very close to Santa Sofia Mosque and Galata Bridge is just ten minutes walking. Perfect for going by walk to the most importants monuments and importants areas in Istanbul. Good Price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast (included) and clean and quiet rooms. From our room we saw Gulhane Park. Just 9 rooms. Very familiar :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Kostantinoupoli”
Reviews.Author: Eirini K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in the old town of Konstantinoupoli and the street is very quite. The owners are very helpful, friendly and willing, you will enjoy the atmosphere of the place. The only thing to take in consideration is the size of the rooms, are really small. Don't hesitate is a perfect solution!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ipinheiro81
Reviews.Content: what an excellent hotel! Metin and his staff were very great people and very helpful and friendly. They gave us lots of tips about the city. The hotel is new and the rooms are beautiful and very clean. And what a great location! Walking distance to all touristic places. I definitely recomend this hotel and I want to come back to Istanbul and stay there again! Thanks Metin and all the staff for the excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Such a cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyPetra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just for two nights at the end of our trip in Turkey but I was so impressed that I wanted to stay longer. The rooms are very nice designed, for breakfast you can have anything from eggs to fruits. The manager of the hotel is a very nice guy and very friendly. Also the location of the hotel is in the Sultanahmet which is the center of Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Kadore
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels for the price I've ever been to. The rooms are modern looking and very inviting. Food for breakfast is also exceptional, it was the only place in Turkey where I stayed that had gozleme for breakfast (and I've been into 6 different hotels, guesthouses etc. on my trip), which is a Turkish dish that I really loved. Also it is located in the Sultanahmet area which is the old town center, so all the main attractions you want to see are within walking distance. And how can I not mention the host, he is very hospitable, talkative, but not intrusive, a great person overall. I hope some of you who will read this will find it helpful, because if I ever return to Istanbul I already know where I'd be staying

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: francesca065Roma
Reviews.Content: the staff is very polite and friendly, rooms basic but modern, clean and functional, rich and tasty breakfast, and of course tea and coffee whenever you want! The hotel's location is also very strategic: just in Sultanamet, and close to all means of transport to reach every other area of Istanbul in a short time

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place and staff”
Reviews.Author: LeoMoraes
Reviews.Content: My days at Minel were amazing. MetinÂ andÂ Muhamed are extremely friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wish to know Istanbul that is, by the way, an awesome city. Going back to Istanbul I pretend to be again at Minel and hope to meet MetinÂ andÂ Muhamed again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: hemaoh
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, cozy but not cramped. Friendly and helpful staff, amazing breakfast, well-equipped and attractive rooms. Historic sites extremely accessible, very near tram stop, reasonably quiet location. Would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming oasis in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: livrpool
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel has a welcoming and cozy ambiance. Right upon stepping in, you can feel that this place was done up with thoughtfulness and care. Although it is a budget hotel, the owners made an effort to make it boutique-like using a white and turquoise theme in their dÃ©cor. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Metin. The rooms are impeccable and comfortable. Room rates are of good value and they include hi-speed wifi, over-head rain shower, clean sheets and a wonderful breakfast spread. The hotel is also in a great location. Itâ€™s close to the tram line and all major sites in the Old City. Itâ€™s also on a quiet street, so you donâ€™t get much noise from the traffic and crowds from the city. Highly recommend this oasis in the city for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely place at the downtown”
Reviews.Author: skynet666
Reviews.Content: We loved it. The stuff was kindly, the rooms are new built and very clean. if you want a good accomodation in istanbul, don't mess, this is the one best choice!:)

Reviews.Title: “Little jewel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: CamilaMagalhaes
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at Minel hotel. Not only because of the location (which is very close to a metro station and to the most important historical spots you'll visit while traveling to Istanbul), but specially because of its friendly environment. When I stayed there, I was traveling alone and Minel's staff did the best they could to make me feel comfortable, offering great tips on the city, or even serving a delicious tea, accompanied by good conversation about politics, economy and history of Turkey (conversations that I really miss now). Also, the rooms are very well furnished (ok, they are not big, but it's not easy to find a big room in a hotel in Istanbul, even more for a reasonable price), very clean and equiped with lcd tv and air conditioning. If you don't want to give up the conveniences of a hotel, but also don't want to have this kind of impersonal treatment given by the big hotel chains, Minel is exactly what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and New Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: g0ateater
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Minel on two ocassions within a fortnight, ideally located property with brand new rooms. Location- very close to all the tourist sites, Topkapi Sarayi, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya. Rooms- Well fitted out and brand new, generous bathrooms and comfortable beds Staff- Great bunch and probably the highlight of my stay here, each one of them makes sure you have a great time Price- Great value for money, given the product quality and location

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: manaderol
Reviews.Content: Minel Hotel is a little jewel in the heart of Sultanahment. It's great value for price, with tastefully decorated and very clean rooms, lovely staff, great conversations and tipps. Also a great place for solo travellers to meet people :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Robbiekvancouver
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at hostels but am travelling with my 60 year old Mom in Turkey, and had trouble finding a hotel that would fit our needs (private washroom, clean, central,not expensive). Minel was perfect - the rooms are perfectly kept, the breakfast is nice, the staff is friendly, and it's nicely tucked away in a quiet lane but located a mere few minutes walk from all the sights. We're back in Istanbul for one night before flying home and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place to stay in Istanbul ... great location!”
Reviews.Author: emerina_bakkes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and had a really nice time. Our room was very small, but so lovely decorated, even with lights under the bed! The shower was very nice with two shower heads, one large and one smaller. The breakfast was great ... lots of fresh fruit (strawberries, watermelon) as well as cheese, bread, polonies, yoghurt, honey, eggs and more. They did not make Turkish coffee, so we got that in town. The service was great as well ... the host is very friendly, talkative and helpful. He showed us to the best and oldest Turkish delight shop, and let us leave our luggage in their store room until our flight the evening. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is very close to a metro station, and right across from Topkapi palace. It is also walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, a nice hamam (Turkish bath) as well as the Galata Tower (although this is a bit further). I have no doubt that I will stay here again if I come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal.”
Reviews.Author: IngevdBerg
Reviews.Content: The main attractiveness of this hotel is the location and the value-for-money. It is located in a quiet street very close to the main attractions of Istanbul. Make sure you have a room on the front side, as the back might experience traffic noise from other streets. The owners have created a very stylisch budget hotel with a real travelers' atmosphere in the downstairs lounge. The rooms are small but the layout of the rooms is very clever so you don't miss the space. The owner and staff are friendly. As part of the laid back atmosphere the owner talks a lot to you in the lounge. However we found that his talks are mostly about himself, this got to our nerves a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb deal! We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: YasminMontreal
Reviews.Content: When we got to Istanbul, we had an unfortunate experience with the hotel we were staying at and decided to move to one close by - the Minel which had just opened. It is more like a Pension but it's amazing. Beautifully and tastefully decorated, the Minel is super clean and reinvigorating place to be amidst the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. Located right in the heart of Istanbul, in small cul de sac right opposite the Gulhani Park which leads to the Topikapi palace and immediate access to the tram, you can't beat this small hotel. Mehtin, the manager and his staff, are very helpful and kind. I would highly recommend staying there. The rates are reasonable and again, the hotel is lovely.

HotelInfo.Name: Minel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Alemdar mah. Guzel Sanatlar sok no 11, Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34121, Turkey
